185959266.review:
I'm going to split this review up into Legacy and Evrima since their so different. (Legacy is the og game, Evrima is public beta that gets updates and is a lot more advanced). 

LEGACY

It's fun (I have 1000 hours in it...) BUT its the result of the devs trying to build a city on a single twig. The systems are simple (which can be a good or bad thing). There a lots of dinosaurs, and unlike evrima you can play rex :) None of the dinosaurs are very unique however. The maps are a mixed bag. V3 is big and nice but has some areas that are way too empty, and Thenyaw is way to small and crampt. 

Many people can never find any english servers and only see chinese servers. There are videos on Yt on how to join english servers.

Note: If you don't like mix packing (dinosaurs of diff species grouping), there aren't really any servers for you. 

So, Legacy is fun if you like the simple mechanics and just want to have dino eat dino. It doesn't recieve updates anymore.

EVRIMA

The game is hard to run, first thing to note. It's horrible optimized, and your FPS can suck (Although personally its been better recently). The dinosaur roster is starting to get big, not much smaller than Legacy, and most of them are very unique. Most dinosaurs in the game are "small" which I like, but if you want to be a giant rex, you cant. 

Evrima is very atmospheric and you really do feel like a dinosaur when ur not having 2 fps. 

If you can actually run it, evrima is very fun. It only recieves an update about once a year however. 

Note: for both versions of the game, they do not give you any sort of tutorial, I suggest you go watch some videos to learn the game a little first. 

I'd give the isle an overall 7/10!

185940024.review:
I have over 400+ hours in this game and can say it's not worth it. This game used to be a blast when official had the Isla Spiro map. Ever since Gateway was released it has been buggy to hell and unplayable. You are constantly lost, starving, or falling off a cliff. Water is bugged out with black boxes so you can't enjoy playing crocs. Music and ambiance just bug out constantly when walking around. The AI are broken as ever. Rubberbanding is an issue. Screen tearing is an issue. It's a game with A LOT of bugs, and it's been like this for 2 YEARS. Nothing has been fixed and it seems devs just don't care, they don't listen to their community. Which is sad cause I used to love this game. Seems like they tackled a project too hard for them to handle and just left it to rot. 

Oh the hackers, don't get me started on the hackers in this game. 

The mechanics in this game used to be so unique compared to POT, that's why this game was so amazing, it used to feel so realistic and I loved that. Now its just unbearable and a headache to boot up. Well... POT has been fun for me at least.

Would I recommend this game? Absolutely not, not until the devs decide to do something with their game again. I'd keep posted with their discord and maybe one day they'll update their game. Almost 10 years in Early access with hardly any improvements? Not good.

However, it seems they spend more time trying to add things to the game because the current version is so broken. Content is extremely slow to be added. The price alone is worth it. Then you see how beautiful the graphics are, How fun It can be to grow as a herbivore and run as pack, constantly looking over your shoulder. Find the meta or the short video on youtube that explains it and abuse it.  In this case, it will be the mix packing of various dinos that will give an unfair advantage to a group of players. Or the way a big carnivore will defend itself against a rock, so that he doesn't die from bullying you and your group for hours on end...   It will get frustrating real fast, but until then; Enjoy playing it.

185610267.review:
[h1] Буквально лучшая игра про динозавров [/h1]
Ок, пришло время написать обзор на это творение.
Игра, как вы поняли из заголовка, буквально является самой лучшей игрой про динозавров на данный момент, в частности с точки зрения реализма. В других играх диносы выглядят как-то.... вырвиглазно, я не спорю, в Isle есть возможность создать просто термоядерную раскраску своему динозавру, но даже так это будет выглядеть стильно, а не как дешевые пластмассовые игрушки из Китая.

[h2] Версии игры [/h2]
Смотри сюда, у этой игры есть две версии: Легаси и Эврима.

[h3] ЛЕГАСИ [/h3]
Это старая и не обновляемая версия, там до сих пор сидят и пердят всякие старики, соваться смысла туда нет из-за корявых хитбоксов и возможности умереть споткнувшись о камень (реально можно сдохнуть если ты не так наступишь на камушек, сам через такое прошел). Там много динозавров, но все упирается в общую, как бы правильно сказать, недоработку это версии.
Короче не ходите, любой роблокс симулятор динозавриков будет более интересным.

[h3] ЭВРИМА [/h3]
Ооооо, а вот это РЕАЛЬНО круто. Данная версия жрет ресурсы компудахтера по боле чем прошлая, но мой игровой ноут ее вывозит на средних настройках.
В этой версии не так много диносов как в прошлой, но это компенсируется объемом механик, которые у них есть. Например троодоны травят, гипсилофодон косплеит перцовый баллончик и плюется в рожу содержимым своего желудка (мой любимый динос), дейнозух -пидо.. может утягивать всех кто легче его на дно реки (а это все динозавры за исключением самого дейнозуха и стегозавра) и так далее.
Карта тоже стала гораздо более живой, система миграции дает стимул для травоядных двигаться по карте, а для хищников идти по следам своего обеда... чтобы быть забитым в фарш толпой пахицелозавров, ну тут уж как повезет.
Ночь тут реально темная и для травычей  это самое неприятное время из-за плохого ночного зрения.
Можно на самом деле много что говорить об этой версии, но сейчас 4 часа ночи и мне хотелось бы пойти на боковую, так что остановлюсь на этом, пусть остальной контент станет для вас приятным сюрпризом.

[h2] Итог [/h2]
10 обосранных штанов из-за дэйнозуха, который с громким воплем вылетает на тебя ночью из реки в самый спокойный момент твоей жизни /10

185576576.review:
I think 'The Isles' could be quite a good game, given a specific set of circumstances.
Unfortunately, my experience was [b]very[/b] bland. [i](and somewhat depressing.) [/i]

[h3] Installation & setup: [/h3]
Initial install was fine, but

[b]Issue 1: [/b] It neglects to tell you about an Anti-cheat program it requires you to install before playing anything, and it gives no clue as to where to find this application.  
to find it, check:   [i] C:\Program Files\Steam\steamapps\common\The Isle  [/i]
*There is a file inside that installs the Anti-Cheat program. 

[b]Issue 2:[/b]  The game wouldn't show me any online servers to join.
It turns out that the game defaults to the Legacy version when installed, which caused the issue.
The problem was resolved by: 
[i] Right clicking the game in my steam library, navigating to the 'Betas' tab, and selecting the Beta Participant: "evrima - EVRIMA Public Branch". [/i]
*This was fine with me, since I wanted to play Evrima anyway, but the fact that you HAD to jump through this hoop to even play was quite ridiculous.

 [h3] Game-play: [/h3]
My experience was nothing like the YouTubers playing the Isles, with one exception;  I did get attacked once by another baby dino, but sadly, aside from two other uneventful encounters with players, I spent two hours wandering the landscape completely and utterly alone.  (except the chickens.. they are bonkers.)

Sadly, All I could find was an empty wasteland of forest covered mountains, calm waters, and ferocious chickens.
*There were some invisible oinking hogs though.

I even spent the last 30 minutes trying to draw as much attention to myself as possible, to see another dino, to make a friend, to battle, to be eaten by a croc, ANY sign of life would do!  But alas.. nothing.  
*I don't know where all 100-200 players were in the 4 servers I tried, but they were not near me. 
**I tried 2 Official and 2 unofficial servers.


[h3] Mechanics: [/h3]
There really wasn't any explanation to anything in the game.
They just plop you down in a bush as a Baby and let you figure out what all the keys do on your own.
I'm all for the idea of hard-coring it, but I would appreciate a small tutorial, a short note, or at least a key for the Sense meter.
When it came to how close you are to dying, forget it, a part from the blood splatters on the screen, it was almost impossible to tell if I was minutes or seconds from death.
*Honestly, If I hadn't watched a few hours of game-play on YouTube before playing this, I'd have been completely lost.

[h3] My favorite Parts: [/h3]
I found it enjoyable to jump from tree-to-tree and cliffside-to-cliffside as a Herrera, swim as a Therizinosaur, and invoke revenge on the chickens as a Diabloceratops.

[h3] Summery: [/h3]
The game had some very nice 2020's graphics, sounds terrific, and provides a platform for you to enjoy starving to death as you sniff the air hoping that its the tree your suppose to bite and not the flowers.
All in all, this game seemed empty, it felt like it had been abandoned, and life was rare to see.

I purchased 'The Isles' along side 'Path of Titans' to give each of them a fair chance.
up to this point, I've only played 2 hours of each.
As much as I wanted 'The Isles' to be a keeper, it doesn't feel finished, and feels extremely Empty.

185560405.review:
Well that was the most atmospheric nothing I've gotten to do in a while.

The amount of fun you have with The Isle is entirely dependent on how many people you meet. And given that there are 100 people to a server you'd be surprised how many people you DON'T run into. Even then, the standard gameplay loop revolves around wandering around aimlessly looking for food/other players that you might go HOURS without seeing, which more often than not means instant death if you're playing a carnivore.

The most fun I've had with The Isle was playing as that prehistoric penguin thing (Beipiaosaurus) and making friends with the select few Crocs that didn't decide to kill me on sight.

Definitely a game that's more fun to watch than to play. Apparently the balancing is horrendous, but I didn't get involved enough in PVP to discover that for myself.

There are definitely better Dinosaur games out there.

185481241.review:
★━━━━━━ Resumo EVRIMA vs LEGACY ━━━━━━★

★━━━━━━ Gráficos ━━━━━━★
EVRIMA: ☑️ Bom.
LEGACY: ☑️ Feio (tem que usar reshade para melhorar).

★━━━━━━ Requisitos ━━━━━━★
EVRIMA: ☑️ PC Potente para rodar o minímo.
LEGACY: ☑️ Pc fraco/médio.

★━━━━━━ História ━━━━━━★
EVRIMA: ☑️ A história não é o foco.
LEGACY: ☑️ A história não é o foco.

★━━━━━━ Jogabilidade/Aprendizado ━━━━━━★
EVRIMA: ☑️ Intermediária pelos tipos de ataques diferenciados.
LEGACY: ☑️ Pela quantia de dinossauros, até entender as dinâmicas, eu deixo como simples-intermediária.

★━━━━━━ Tempo de jogo médio ━━━━━━★
EVRIMA: ☑️ Variável.
LEGACY: ☑️ Variável.

★━━━━━━ Áudio e músicas ━━━━━━★
EVRIMA: ☑️ Muito bom.
LEGACY: ☑️ Muito bom.

★━━━━━━ Bugs ━━━━━━★
EVRIMA: ☑️ Alguns bugs que atrapalham.
LEGACY: ☑️ Bugs de combate.

★━━━━━━ Idade das pessoas que jogam ━━━━━━★
EVRIMA: ☑️ Adolescentes e adultos.
LEGACY: ☑️ Adolescentes e adultos.

★━━━━━━ Comunidade ━━━━━━★
EVRIMA: ☑️ Comunidade normal.
LEGACY: ☑️ Comunidade normal.

★━━━━━━ Pontos a considerar ━━━━━━★
EVRIMA: Um combate que possui muitas mecânicas e não é fluido, o gráfico é bonito mas não é otimizado. Possui muitas mecânicas porém muitas inúteis, os desenvolvedores não se preocupam com o público, o jogo não tem equilíbrio, não tem suporte a mods, o sistema de grupos é horrível, possui IAs mas são horríveis, o mapa é horrível, as atualizações não saem quando planejado e quando saem vem com pouco qualidade (até mesmo quando o prazo se extende). Não existe balanceamento para o sistema de ninho, se voce fizer, irá morrer, o sistema de dieta também não te permite fazer ninho, pois se fazer isso, vai ficar desnutrido. (como eu disse, fazem algo mas não fazem bem). Dinossauros de 500kg tem a velocidade da luz (qual o sentido?). Os desenvolvedores prometem algo e nunca entregam (isso é histórico para players que jogam antes mesmo da versão legacy que conhecemos)

LEGACY: Já não recebe mais updates, e não tem suporte a mods, mas ainda tem um charme nostálgico, tudo nele é simples porem funcional, retirando o combate, porém a diversidade de dinossauros é muito grande. Para alguém que gosta mais de um simulador é algo mais atraente, e não para alguém que liga apenas para o combate.

Ambos: Não contém modelos realistas.

Nota Final, levando em conta o atual mercado, e levando em conta que você deseja jogar um "Simulador de Dinossauro" e não "Jogo de pvp com Dinossauros":
EVRIMA: 6.
LEGACY: 7.

185395069.review:
(All hours I have are in Evrima and on carnivores, mainly omniraptor. I have not played legacy.)

I love this game. I think that there is a satisfying learning curve to it. Yes, you will spend your first few hours running around dying to either starvation or bigger dinos, as there currently isn't any sort of tutorial in EVRIMA. But then you'll start to learn what sounds each AI prey will make, as well as the calls of the other playable dinos. It is also extremely easy to just look up pointers online, as there are plenty of resources for it. I like the realism of having to actually think and work for your food rather than it just being handed to you on a silver platter. That's what survival games are meant to be. If you don't like the idea of this, then maybe it isn't the game for you.

I will admit, I do think that some of the herbis are a bit overpowered and even a group of fully grown omniraptors can struggle to take down a larger herbivore. But in that case, you just learn to avoid them. Wait for something bigger and stronger to come along and then go and scavenge for the leftovers afterwards. 

There does seem to be an issue with hackers, although I am thankfully yet to encounter one. I have probably just got lucky.  This is an issue that definitely needs to be addressed, and hopefully will come in time as I am sure the devs are more than aware of it. 

I think that from what I've read in the negative reviews, it's mainly just salty players who haven't actually given this game a chance (sub 3 hrs playtime). It definitely gets more enjoyable the more you play and learn the mechanics. However, the development is objectively quite slow. If that isn't for you, then don't buy the game. It seems to only be a pretty small team working on it. If you don't mind this and can simply enjoy it for what it is, and are willing to put in some hours to learn how the game works, then I definitely recommend buying this.

185367755.review:
Ah, "The Isle"! Um jogo que é um verdadeiro presente para os amantes de dinossauros e da natureza selvagem. As belezas do The Isle não estão apenas em seus gráficos impressionantes, mas também na experiência imersiva que ele proporciona.

Imagine caminhar por vastas paisagens pré-históricas, onde cada floresta, montanha e rio é renderizado com um nível de detalhe que faz você quase sentir a brisa das folhas e o cheiro da terra molhada. O som ambiente, com o canto dos pássaros e o rugido distante dos predadores, adiciona uma camada extra de realismo que faz o jogador mergulhar ainda mais na atmosfera do jogo.

Os dinossauros em The Isle são verdadeiras obras de arte. Cada espécie é recriada com uma precisão impressionante, desde o Tiranossauro Rex imponente até os menores herbívoros. Os movimentos são fluidos e naturais, fazendo com que cada encontro seja uma experiência inesquecível.

Mas não é só a aparência que conta. O comportamento dos dinossauros, baseado em um complexo sistema de IA, faz com que eles ajam de maneira realista, caçando em grupos, protegendo seus filhotes e reagindo ao ambiente e a outros jogadores de forma imprevisível.

Outro ponto de destaque são os ciclos de dia e noite e as condições climáticas. Você pode começar sua jornada ao amanhecer, sob um céu azul claro, e se encontrar à noite, tentando se esconder de predadores durante uma tempestade feroz. Essas mudanças dinâmicas no ambiente não só são visualmente deslumbrantes, mas também impactam diretamente a jogabilidade.

Em resumo, The Isle é um jogo que se destaca não apenas pelas suas mecânicas e desafios, mas também pelas suas belezas naturais e pela imersão que proporciona aos jogadores. Uma verdadeira celebração do que a natureza pré-histórica poderia ter sido.

185318973.review:
A reason not to buy the game.
   The game can be an amazing hardcore survival experience with exceptional immersion. The problem emerges after spending time being a humble student of the wilderness. You spend hours honing your reflexes, learning your strengths and weaknesses. You use your hard earned skills to stalk, and kill your prey, then that pray tells his 6 comrades on discord where you are and you find a herd of both carnivores and herbivores of all types heading towards your location or their friends body. Maybe you out maneuver them all, disengage and continue with your life. 15 minutes later you make it to the next hotspot only to realized you've been playing for 2 hours after you got home from work and its 11pm now theirs not enough people in the server and you have to log out or starve to death. Next day 3 fully grown herbivores decide they are bored and use their unmatched attack and defenses to kill everything around on sight and guard the body. You were a smart player and watched your stamina on your way there so you can retreat if a situation like that occurred but because of that you also took too long to get there and are now starving with no time to make a similar trip to the next spot. Game offers a map that is 14km*2 but only 100 players(coming from someone who has crawled through the forest for an hour to find a bear in Call Of The Wild. This means know the hotspots or starve).
 When you learn the game and the servers, instances like this will be rarer but WILL still happen. It is part of any game. The problem is this game tries to be something it cant. That no game can be. Truly realistic. The devs realized this after release, scraped the first version, released an almost entirely different game and the same thing happens. Now its just a slow trickle of adding content every now and then to get a little surge in sales. The day the game is officially "finished" everyone will have a "is this all we got?" moment.



We will get our dinosaur game one day... but not today.

185281953.review:
The design document for this game is probably just the words "Jurassic Park" on a white board that hasn't been wiped down in 10 years.

The problem is the herbivore/carnivore divide and the fact that it can never be balanced in a satisfying way.
Herbivore > Carnivore is the current meta. They're easier to grow, easier to play, and usually fight better than their carnivore counterparts. In a word: better. Carnivores just eat each other, because the map is too damn big and AI doesn't seem to spawn except in singular spots that, of course, get camped. And if they try to fight an herbivore, they either can't catch it or get killed by it, unless they vastly outsize their prey.

Your typical server ends up being split in two; the herbivores sit around eating bushes that don't run away from them and kill any carnivore that comes too close, and the carnivores run around trying to find a food spawn, usually failing and dropping dead. Many servers clear corpses to reduce lag, so even these carnivores dropping dead all over the place aren't contributing to the problem.

This game needs two kinds of servers; carnivore servers, where everyone's competing to hunt and grow and fight each other, and herbivore servers, where it's a cooperative game about surviving (AI) dinosaur terrors that want to eat you. Both of these are quality ideas for a game. Smooshing them together sounds like a good idea, but because of the way this game functions as-is, it just fails at either.

The map is too big, as well. Vast swathes of it are empty death traps where nothing spawns, with no visual tell as to which is which. Exploration is actively punished, and any landmark you see has nothing for you. If you're an explorer, DO NOT BUY. You will hate it. It's baffling that this game managed to make a Pteranodon's flight feel so meaningless and bad.

This game is a perfect example of how you can get caught in the details and miss the bigger picture. Tweaking dino stats will NEVER solve this game's problems. Evrima was supposed to be an overhaul, and it was, but it only made the carnivore situation worse.

As for Omnivores? They're herbivores that can eat frogs. There's no other difference.

怎么说呢 如果你不是一个狂热的恐龙爱好者就不要买了 为什么？以下是我的看法
地图问题：你总共就那么点人 你搞那么大的图干什么？
食物以及AI问题：我不知道是不是你们懒得修BUG了，就先说鳄鱼吧 新版本更新之后只能随机出生然而大部分龙全在南平原你基本根本去不了 要么在路上被咬死要么就是渴死或者饿死 海水鳄也不太可能因为你没有吃的 水里还有能把幼年鳄鱼一口吞的，有时候水里不刷鱼 活活饿死，陆地也基本一样大地图 看不见任何陆地AI

总结：游戏是个好游戏 但是毁在地图大 玩家分散开 养龙成本高 品种太少 更新太慢 地图地形BUG多容易卡地形出不来 容易饿死 我希望制作组可以尽快改善这些方面 改善地图 更新更多的龙品种 让玩家有更多的出生点选择以及龙的选择

185192440.review:
Ich liebe dieses Spiel ♥

Ein Kindheit's Traum geht hier in Erfüllung. Endlich ein gutes Qualitatives Dino Spiel und das von einem kleinen Entwickler Studio! Obacht es ist ein Early Acces Titel für 20€. Nicht vergleichbar mit AAA Titel von großen Firmen die Millionän Budgets haben....und selbst die vermasseln es regelmäßig.

Ich übernehme auch keine Haftung für Rechtschreibfehler und diese Reszission spiegelt meine Meinung wieder und soll garantiert niemanden Persönlich angreifen! Also seit Lieb ♥

Vorab muss ich betonen das ich erst seit kurzem das Spiel verfolge und Spiele. Kann zu älteren Zuständen des Spieles leider keine Meinung abgeben. Im Aktuellen Zustand ist "The Isle : Evrima" aber klasse (Besser geht natürlich immer)!! Weshalb ich viele negative Aktuellen Kommentare (von den letzten 2-3 Wochen) nicht verstehen kann dazu aber später.

:::Rezension:::

Wär ein Hardcore Survival Game mit Dinos sucht, wo man Taktisch und Strategisch vorgehen muss, ist hier auf jedenfall richtig! Ich kann aber verstehen wenn es nicht jedem's Geschmack trifft. Es ist Schwer hineinzukommen und braucht eine Zeit bis man sich richtig wohlfühlt. Wenn du Stirbst ist dein Dino weg und du beginnst von vorne. Wer das alles nicht mag ist hier Falsch. Hat man aber die Mechanic's der Dinos verstanden und weiß wie man vorgehen muss und man hat noch ein paar Freunde im Schlepptau dann wirst du den Spaß und nerven kitzel deines Lebens haben.

Grafisch ist das Spiel, bis auf einige Textur bug's und Glitches, richtig gut. Die Map Gateway und ihre Biome sind liebevoll gestaltet. Selten solch eine Tolle Karte gesehen wo auch tatsächlich die Fauna zum Tarnen genutzt werden kann und auch genutzt werden muss! Da haben viele AAA Titel ihre Probleme wo aber hier gut funktioniert.

Die Dino Mechanic's finde ich auch sehr gut gelungen. Man muss sie nur verstehen, lernen wie man sie Erfolgreich einätzt und man wird erfolg haben. Zwar hatte das "Troodon" und der "Dilo" in der Realität kein Gift und das ist eher Fantasy. Dennoch finde ich die Spielweise gut Gelungen!!

Die Dinos selber sind auch sehr Realistisch (Nach heutigen Wissenschaftlichen stand) dargestellt. Zumindest zu 80% Natürlich gibt es hier und da auch Freiraum für eigene Interpretationen. Schließlich Zocken wir ein PC Spiel und keine 100% Wissenschaftlich standfest Fundierte ZDF Dokumentation. 

Kurz und Knapp. Tolles, grafisch gute gelungenes Dino Spiel, wo viel Spaß bringen kann und das für den kleinen Geldbeutel! Kann ich im aktuellen Zustand nur weiter Empfehlen!!

185110721.review:
I'd like to start by saying this; Evrima is a great version of this game, it's fairly in-depth and there are a lot of niche things to learn. The developers are fairly slow to update as it seems like a very small percentage of the dev team actually work on the game, with each update they implement game altering bugs, as of the recent Maiasaura update, a bug where the Pterodactylus (small birds) attack fish the moment a Pteranodon picks it up, often resulting in newborn Pt's being absolutely sniped out of the sky or causing them to starve to death. Along with bugs like eating certain plants causes you to have to rejoin the server, being unable to safe-log, which results in you being stuck in a large queue and possibly die to a newborn Beipi. Some of the community is great, some of it isn't. That's just how communities will be.

BUT, there is a serious cheater infestation in the official servers and they have a very small unpaid team (who have jobs and lives outside of the game) that handle it, you don't get the 5+ hours of your life that you spent growing a dino back, as they aren't allowed to give you it back, even if you have solid undeniable evidence. 9/10 of the administrators seem to make little to no effort to engage with reports, and by the time they get around to doing anything about it, the cheaters have murdered half of the server and gone to bed.

With all of that said, I do not recommend the game in it's current state of cheater management.

185098342.review:
9 years of developement while ignoring community feedback let to an unbalanced and barely playable game. 
The main problems are as follows:

-The lead Dev is absurdly toxic towards the player base and ignores feedback. He also sometimes implements random changes that make no sense or are supposed to make sense with "Future content" but break balance in the current state of the game. His behaviour is perceived by many as impulsive, toxic and childish.

-The map is way to big and empty for the game. Where there aren't players AI does not spawn either causing cernivores to start unless they visit a player hotspot. Of those there is exactly ONE at the south river. All action is concentrated at a 200mx200m area. Look up hotspot maps if you don't believe me.

-The official servers are plagued by cheaters flying around with land carnivores, killing players while they themselves are in godmode. This is not due to bad anti-cheat alone but also due to awefully client sided game design. Calculating damage and health client sided is something no experienced multiplayer dev would do.

-There are admins that you can contact via Discord, sadly they will simply ignore any DMs although that is the official way of reporting cheaters. They also do no compensate players for dinos lost that way even when they got proof.

-Gameplay is boring due to most of the map being lifeless. Also stamina regen makes the game a sitting simulator for pteranodon players. 

-When the servers are empty you'll die of starvation if the game does not decide to spawn AI near you, which it rarely does.

-The AI spawn system actively discourages looking for food and rewards just staying in one area.

-Evrima has way less Dinosaurs which is a problem since the DEFAULT branch (Legacy) is dead. I don't get why they don't make Evrima default then...

-The Evrima branch start menu breaks at 21:9 and requires players to manually edit the gameusersettings.ini file.

-There are many bugs like invisible birds attacking you if you play Ptera.

DON'T buy it!

185031471.review:
The Isle is very beautiful, the animations are impressive and the sound design is peak. But! After almost ten years, barely anything has changed in development. The search for realism forgot the most important aspect of a game, fun gameplay.

It already starts with even trying to get the game starting. New players are thrown into the "old" version or "Legacy", not knowing that Evrima is hidden in the "beta" option on steam properties where the actual development moves. A simple fix would be just to switch them around so players can be instantly thrown into the "real new game". Or at the start of the game, a selection of either Legacy or Evrima.

Once the game starts, no tutorial is alright in this survival game but getting even food is for some reason, the most rare and hardest part ever. When the game tries to be realistic, then wildlife should actually be running around, plants should be food etc. I have personally tried almost all creatures and barely any food was even visible while the hunger was falling faster than my motivation to keep going.

Then growth of your dino is very, very time consuming. The current "gameplay" consists of hiding, trying not to starve and this for sometimes hours. Once you are fully grown, there is nothing else to be done than fighting others, which is alright if you even manage to get this far. An entertaining way to fix this would be some sort of system, where "quests" of "eat this to get a massive boost in growth, do this to mutate growing faster" are established.

Buggy disjointed mess full of cheaters, feels like there's a total of 3 people working on the game with the state it's in and the time it's been out. Their idea of good graphics is 100,000,000 bushes and foliage, the sound of rain will drown out literally all other sounds and will go on for hours, the sun is more like an old closet lightbulb that's been going out for years and flickers between nonexistent and glaring, their idea of good gameplay is hours of a walking(starving) simulator all for no growth and for it to be ended by hackers in the blink of an eye or getting bugged into rocks with a laughable attempt at an unstuck command. Speaking of starving, the time it takes to starve makes 0 sense with how long the days and nights are, you will starve to death in less than a full day/night cycle. Nobody knows what a hitbox looks like in this game. It's a bait and switch early access title held up by youtubers and reviewers seemingly making their own fun but at the end of the day it's just their creativity and imagination and it has nothing to do with the actual gameplay itself. 2/10

Edit: Maybe I was a little mad when I wrote this lmao. I'll add  ways they can improve the game, aka fix the game, aka develop.

1. Actually fix the game breaking bugs your community has been yelling at you about for literal years.
2. Please release updates and content in a timely manner, this is wildly unprofessional for a studio with a single game in early access for almost a decade.
3. Please get a better anti-cheat system/detection/actually hire people who can monitor and moderate.
4. Fix the lighting, there is 0 reason animals that can see in the dark should be blind during not even a full sunset.
5. Please EQ your sounds for the love of god the rain is deafening.
6. If your game is touting itself as a survival simulator please make the survival part not artificially difficult with no AI spawns, a massive map with barely any discernible landmarks, insane growth times, insane starve times, insane sickness times, and the clunkiest combat known to mankind.

I wholeheartedly do not recommend this and regret my purchase.

184887277.review:
Pros
The game is really fun to play and looks great as well. It feels like each different dinosaur has it's own unique play style and on top of that you have mutations to try some different builds out there as well. The game is really fun to play with friends although is not necessary to have some fun. Can't wait for more things to be added that you can play as since it seems like each one in already feels really different from the next. The graphics, models, and animations have a lot to do with the immersion that makes the game stick out for me.

Cons
There are two main issues that I ran into in my experience picking up the game.

The first issue is that there is no ingame explanation of things like patrols or migration paths or an ingame map so that you know where you are. Until one of my friends who had played the game for a while mentioned it I had no idea that you had to hold the smell button in order to get an increase in the radius for different scents either. It's basically impossible to understand unless you use some outside resource.

The other issue was with the number of official servers. Having the large number of players on a map that is as huge as it is makes the game. Unfortunately that usually results in having to wait in a queue for a bit or join another regions servers where ping is a bit higher.

Scroll to the bottom for a summary

Honestly this game is amazing. In the debate of Path of Titans vs The Isle, having over 50 hours in both I would  prefer The Isle (Mostly because PoT questing to grow system is pretty annoying and boring, although the rest of the game is amazing). If you have become worried by the excessive growth times of the dinosaurs, there are accelerated growth servers (Isla Pandora 2X Growth 2X AI is my favorite). This game is amazing if you love nature and dinosaurs, since it very much leans into realism and has made the Biology nerd in me happy. However, the game updates much slower than Path of Titans does. The Isle devs, if you're reading this I would reccommend you make the apex dinosaurs DLCs so you can hire more staff and also limit the amount of people playing "OP" dinosaurs. Also it would be really cool if you went and tweaked how fast hunger depletes a bit just to make the game a bit less frustrating and more realistic. I have also found the playerbase to be very sweet and welcoming, especially on unofficial servers, which have more rules and are often moderated along with having a Discord. However, this is just constructive criticism I have, to minimize the flaws of the game in my opinion (but almost every game has some kind of flaws). If anyone wants to comment what dinosaur they are most excited for here is mine: Therizinosaurus :)

(Or a big Saurapod like Puerto but they haven't announced the possibility of that in evrima)

184848730.review:
To their credit, the devs do keep this  game updated with content even though its been in development hell for a DECADE (2015).

tldr: good idea executed badly 

Whilst the concept is great and the game looks stunning at times... It's an afk/walking simulator that requires time investment to grow your dinos only to loose them to;

- Cheaters, the games been out so long that you can break it in many ways. Most of the time you'll be resting in the middle of nowhere with a server population of 2 on a huge map and be discovered and one shot within 10mins or so. The other popular cheat is a Stego coming at you at 80km (normally limited to like 15-25km) faster than any other dino.
- Sever performance, the LITERAL WORST of any game in history. I AM NOT JOKING. A game where poor decisions and timing means the difference between losing hours of progress is NOT the game that needs horrible rubberbanding, very poor colision detection, hit reg, massive delays and huge ping spikes. Server performance naturally gets worse with more players in dense zones. Averaging 50ms if you're isolated to 120ms in places with 20+ individuals (server pop cap is 100). There is also only 2 servers for Australia, so only 200 people can play at a time (though very rarely are they full, but that leads into the next issue).
- The game will screw you, feeding and hunting are how you keep your dinos alive. For herbivoures, you'll have to migrate to food zones, a pain in the ass when you finally get to one then the server moves it instantly to the other side of a huge map. Carnivores must hunt either other players or A.I spawns. When the servers are full your only issue becomes the CHEATING. But with a server pop of 10 you really need to rely on A.I spawns. The devs claim they're more likely to occur close to migration zones to encourage PVP but in reality they are static on the map. Survival often comes down to "did you spawn close to one of these zones" if not jump off a cliff and try again. 
- Once you've tried all the dinos, that's it. You might have a fav or two but there really isn't any reason to keep playing. I'll jump on once they've realease a new dino but again, stales easily. 

Dinos are cool

The Isle, the game you leave running in the background so your dino grows while you play something else. Evrima is undoubtedly better than Legacy ever was, but that doesn’t mean its flaws are excusable.
As a long time Legacy player, it's heartbreaking to see how little meaningful progress has been made over the years. If I ever won the lottery, I'd genuinely consider funding a new dev team just to finish this game. It's almost comical that, after nearly four years, we're still dealing with such an incomplete experience. The wait for promised content is painfully slow, and players are left to accept that "new additions" might arrive years after being teased. All that being said, this game is undeniably beautiful. The graphics and map design are stunning, though they're overshadowed by terrible optimisation issues and painfully small server sizes for a map this massive. If you were to ask me whether I’d recommend it, my answer would be, absolutely—in about 20-30 years when the game is actually finished(lets hope its not longer than that). For now, it’s a masterpiece stuck in development limbo and will continue to be due to incompetent devs. : )

The "base" game appears that you install and access by default appears to be an old legacy version with few players, no official servers and no further dev support.

Tutorials are lacking, so YT vids or the wiki are mandatory.

184772354.review:
This game is Day Z and for me, that isn't a compliment. You spend 90% of your time wandering around doing nothing or growing in a bush. When the action happens is can be really fun but that's a very small portion of the game, the juice simply isn't worth the squeeze.

Pros: High highs, pulse raising chases and horror jump scares. Visually nice, immersive with scenic environments. I'm trying to thank of anything else positive to say and I am struggling. Mutations are fun i guess.

Cons: Horrid performance, if you have a low end PC don't even bother, i have like 50ish games ranging from new to old, this the worst FPS performance I've ever had.  Downtime, like I stated earlier you just walk aimlessly or sit in a bush AFK growing your Dino, bad design and extremely boring, oh and i forgot to mention there are a very limited amount of servers, so if you want to play on your native server, you can literally be looking at wait times of over an 1hr, no joke 1hr. Now for the most damning part, and ultimately what made me quit playing. The shear JANK of it all, bugs, glitches, server restarts, exactly like DAY Z it feels like a game that's never going to be finished despite being in development for 10yrs now. Every single time i logged i had to swap vsync on and off or else i would have 20 FPS. On character creator my mouse pointer dissapeared multiple times, making me believe the game had crashed until i figured out that my mouse pointer was invisible. Worse of all by far was the night vision glitch, made my game unplayable at night 10's hours trying to play Deino, and all i could see at night was a black screen so I just sat and starved or got killed by other Deinos who werent getting the glitch at the time. This is a completely game breaking bug that's been posted about for like a year and nothings been done yet. 

Conclusion: This is a game just like DayZ, where its much more enjoyable to watch someone else play it because they edit out the hours of nothingness, it doesn't respect your time whatsoever. You can spend 6 hours growing your dino just lose all your progress to bugs and glitches server restarts ect. If you are a fan of non modded Dayz, and want a similar survival experience but with Dino's you may enjoy this. But for me the bugs glitches, and sheer amount of time spent doing  nothing, make this a hard pass.

184735976.review:
Willkommen zu meiner Rezension.

Als erstes möchte ich klar stellen, dass jeder, der dieses Spiel kauft, ein Spiel mit einer sehr steilen Lernkurve beginnen wird.

Meine Erfahrungen als Einzelspieler waren grausam. Man betritt dem offiziellen Server und bekommt keine Einführung oder Tutorial. Jeder Dino hat spezielle Attacken oder sogar spezielle Fähigkeiten. Es gibt viele Mechanismen, die man benutzen kann und alles, was das Game dir sagt, ist "E to drink" oder "E to eat" oder "G to grab".
Das ist sehr frustrierend.

Nachdem ich die ersten Hürden des Spiels überwunden hatte und mir einige Informationen aus dem Internet besorgt hatte, um das Spiel wirklich spielen zu können, bin ich in die nächste Falle des Spiels getappt. Als Fleischfresser bin ich häufiger verhungert als durch alle anderen Todesarten zusammen. Das Problem ist, dass ich bis heute nicht herausgefunden habe, wie ich besser an Ki-Futter kommen kann. Aber ich habe gemerkt, dass man sich in diesem Spiel auf seine Ohren und seinen Geruchssinn verlassen muss, um ein Ziel zu finden und zu verfolgen.

Am Ende habe ich jetzt viele Informationen über das Game und verstehe sowohl die Dinosaurier als auch die Spielmechanik viel besser. Das Game macht mir sehr viel Spaß und ich hatte bis jetzt auch viele schöne Erlebnisse.

Was ich jedem neuen Spieler raten würde, ist sich Informationen über das Game zu besorgen.
Hier ist meine Liste für Leute, die Englisch können. (Es gibt sicher auch gutes Material auf Deutsch)

Liste:
Anfänger Guide
https://youtu.be/0QH7aZFjMpA?si=q_cUyek9fA2U1VXe

Dinos
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLPjhw8w_5e3qzIOWikb7E95BGPa0A_Ajc

Versteckte Mutationen
https://youtu.be/mp9nfK-L73w?si=gReFa1NItWuCnc3Y

PC Leistung/Qualität
https://youtu.be/NKN-2-QhjDc?si=g3go-IAU8OFVuu6L


Zusammenfassung
Das Spiel ist wunderschön und zieht einen in seine Welt hinein. Du musst jede Entscheidung die du triffst mit dem Gedanken "Kann ich das überleben?" treffen. Man lernt viele Leute kennen und macht mit ihnen gute und natürlich auch schlechte Erfahrungen.

Wünsche
Bitte lasst die Dinos mehr wiegen (nicht im Spiel als Stat, sondern in der Physik), denn wenn man als Dino über eine kleine Vertiefung im Boden läuft, fliegt man direkt weg.

Unter anderem würde ich vorschlagen, dass man Open Breeding machen kann, so dass man auch ohne Nestcode beitreten kann, wenn man will.

184683802.review:
I've been playing The Isle on and off for years now. When there's new things, I'll pop in and play it hard for a few weeks then pause until the next batch of new stuff or I get a random urge to play again. So I feel I can speak with some level of experience on the current quality and overall development cycle. As a preface, I'll say this: I love The Isle. I always have and I always will. My critique and frustration come from a place of love and wanting to see it thrive and grow into the game I know it can be. 

As a note, I'm reviewing the Evrima build specifically which is accessible by selecting it under betas in the preferences. Evrima is the only build the devs are currently working on as far as I know. The old build (the one that installs by default) is very outdated and essentially abandoned by the few devs they have. Evrima is also far better, despite having less playable dinosaurs. 

The game is very much a love/hate relationship. The ecosystem simulator aspect is very unique and superbly done. The additions they've made for migration zones, patrol zones, scent systems, mutations, and various dino ecological niches are VERY good and show the game is very slowly moving in the right direction. The dinosaur designs are superb and the realism is unmatched when it comes to the Gateway map, locomotion, animations, sounds, you name it. Heck even the plant life and ambient noises in various locations are supremely immersive. It all combines to make The Isle Evrima a truly rare jewel in these types of open world survival games. 

That being said... It has problems. And a lot of them. So many in fact that even someone who adores the game has trouble ignoring them. (To the point of making a long winded diatribe about it on a public review page, apparently.) The development cycle is astonishingly slow, even for a small team. You can report game breaking bugs, but it may take literal years for them to even be acknowledged let alone addressed. They've gotten better at this, but the track record is rough and hard to overlook. 

The servers in Evrima are my main issue at the moment. Realistically, the Official servers are the only ones anyone plays on as the non official ones tend to be empty, insta-grow death match PVP servers, or too high ping for people to be able to do anything on. The queue times are absurd just to get into the Official servers as there's not enough of them for the current active player count. Unless you sneak in right after server reset (I set timers on my phone for them just so I can spam refresh and maybe actually play the game) or play super late night/early morning in the timezone for that server, you can expect 50-60 person queues. Or more. And since people know these queues are absurdly long, they tend to not leave the server once in. So you might sit in a queue for over and hour. Or hours plural. Not to mention there's currently a major issue where you'll get randomly disconnected from queue for no apparent reason or explanation. So you can sit in line for an hour, get to #1 in line, then DC right before you get in. Then have it happen AGAIN on another server. 

Hackers are absolutely everywhere. Admins try to keep up with removing them, but it's still very commonplace to spend hours growing something big only for all that progress to be completely destroyed by a hacker that kills you in seconds. It's why I stick to small fast grow time dinos now, so when something inevitably kills me out of nowhere I'm not too upset. 

There's major balance issues with dinos, buggy animations, and the PVP (which is required for some dinos to have a reasonable chance at surviving) tends to be a buggy ping-dependent mess of rubber banding and broken hit registration. Dinos you hit and hear make the pain noise won't have actually taken damage, and people can kill you sometimes by biting several body lengths away from you. And it's sometimes impossible to tell if it's the server, or if it was a hacker. 

I could go on and on but I'm nearly at the end of my queue to get in and play my Beipi. Fingers crossed it doesn't DC me right at the end for a THIRD time tonight. 

TL;DR: Game's amazing when it works. Beautiful. Fun. Lots of memorable random interactions with other players. But holy heck do you need the patience of a saint to get past the frustration of broken stuff and servers that I assume are powered by a drunk Dibble on a treadmill. Enjoy at your own risk. Maybe 2025 will finally be our year. (If I repeat that every year, I'll eventually be right.)

184671427.review:
Жизнь моя за 12 часов.
Родился я Карнотавром на Северо-западном хребте, не далеко от водоёма с пресной водой, где обитают вкусные лягушки и не далеко от пляжика с аппетитными черепашками. Не знал я своих родителей, ведь я остался последним выжившем в своём гнезде, после вылупления, я не знал каков суров этот мир и каков чудесен он с другой стороны. Отправившись туда, не зная куда. Я повстречал не большое стадо Карнотавров из 8 дино. Они меня приютили и вырастили, научили и я стал их частью в семье.   Было очень замечательно, мы даже повстречали ещё одно стадо Карнотавров из 7 дино и объединились в одно стадо из 5 групп. Спустя какое-то время, мы решили эмигрировать через дамбу на Северное озеро, но на пути нас ждали 5ро взрослых Тенонтозавров, та наша группа из последних примкнувших к нам, решила их одолеть, но не то та было, они были убиты, не навредив им ни капли. Нас снова 8 и мы решили отступить, обойдя. Но пройдя дамбу, нас снова поджидала опасность, у водоёма, 1го утащил Дейнозух, ведь тот решил нахлебав воды у обрыва водоёма, а не как мы, на мелководье. 2го растерзали 2е Птеранодонтов и нас осталось 3е, которые отступили в джунгли избегая опасность с полупустым желудком. Пока мы шли до Северного озера ещё 1 пал на тропе, пал от жажы и ран, полученных от Птеранодонтов. Дойдя до Северного озера, нас осталось 2е, Двое, самка и самец дожившие пройдя этот путь. Прожив здесь, мы через неделю отправились на Восточные равнины, но что-то нас вразумив, мы решили вернуться назад, на то место, где встретились изначально - это пляж. Спустя недели, мы чудом вернулись без происшествий. Там мы снова встретили 3х, совершенно маленьких Карнотавров, мы не думая, решили их приютить, обучить, и выростить. Видимо это и толкнуло нас вернуться назад, вернуться, что б помочь потомству оказавшиеся без защиты. Но не тут та было, Шесть Пахицефалозавров из под тяжка выскочили из джунглей, ды бы выгнать нас с пляжа, нам пришлось отступить, спасая детёнышей. Снова, бросив родное место, мы скитались по берегу моря, по возвышенностям джунглей на Северо-западном хребте. Мы обучали, ростили, защищали и воспитывали детёнышей как своих. Но тот самый, трагичный момент случился у водопоя. Тогда когда я наказал малых быть осторожным и в случае чего прятаться и не шуметь и если что, бежать. Пошел я искать пропитания для нас. Пройдя пару метров, на меня выскочили Цератозавры, я не смог их обалеть, да даже убежать. Они меня сбили с ног и перегрызли мне горло, ко мне поспешила моя партнёрша, но и её на этом месте не стало... Теперь мы не знаем что станет с теми тремя малышами, которых мы выхаживали. Но я знаю теперь точно, что в этом мире, смысл жизни таков, что твоя смерть не будет напрасной, если ты не поможешь своим младшим дино, ведь это и есть жизнь.

184667993.review:
Not for the weak hearted. Played Legacy first not knowing about the Beta "Evrima". Legacy seems more direct, get in, track dinos, kill each other, more like a pvp sandbox.
Then ran into a huge group of Carnos, and joined them, they told me and my friends about Evirma, said they didn't like it because unlike Legacy, you couldn't just team up and find ur friends instantly, you had to go find them on a map that's 225 square kilometers, Ark Survival is 48 square kilometers for reference!
But I wanted to give it a go, so we tried it, and I enjoy the Beta sooo much more, so everyone has a personal preference. Also there's more Dinos you can play in Evirma, for example the Pteranodon, which if you play for a couple hours, the map starts to make sense, and its easy to learn.
I enjoyed tho flying around the map, I ran into a couple other Pteranodons on my journey. We emoted to each other that we were friendly, and joined a team together, went scavenging and hunting, then get to a watering hole and a raptor kills us all. Just a fair warning, you will die constantly, more often from starvation than dinos if your a carnivore that is, until you get better at the game, and figure out where to find Dinos and where they tend to congregate (it's watering holes). Once you learn the map, and where all the fresh water is, it becomes much more enjoyable.
Definitely plays more like a Dino Royale.. load in as a Dino.. spend an hour or a few growing and surviving, then randomly get chomped and lose all ur progress. Its more for the experience of each play through, so if you don't like hardcore modes in games, or dying and losing everything often, this game isn't for you. I've tried official and modded servers, and have really enjoyed the modded not cuz they were much different, but a little more rules and role play (i.e. same breed dinos cant kill each other, etc.) made the game more interesting. If you just wanna join in with a bunch of friends and kill other Dinos, then Legacy is more fun, but playing solo I have to recommend the Evrima Beta, also the "Herrerasaurus" is the most fun solo Dino for me, cuz he can climb up trees to escape predators, or jump down on even larger prey than himself.
My buddy bought me the game for Christmas to play with him, so it was free, but it was on sale at the time for $13 and I definitely would recommend it on sale.
Even for full price of $20 for a game that seems to have a massive massive community, and still actively being worked on, I'd feel safe buying it at full price even.

Combat: Could be a lil better, but definitely get different attacks/experiences with different Dinos

Music: very well done, music is awesome and immersive.

Community: very cool, as many people as have ate me, there's been even more that have spared me or just had good vibes with, repeatedly hopping or crouching may to show ur friendly may save ur life xD

Exploration: definitely one of the largest game maps ive ever seen. with 225 square kilometers it absolutely dwarfs games like Ark, however there seems to be less monuments, or watering holes, or things that really stand out than I'd expect for a map being so big, which seems to then limit the actual functional/usable space of the map. And a new player might traverse 60% of the map and never find anyone cuz hes not looking in the areas that would be functionable, however if they eventually could have 2k players on a server vs 100-300, the space would be very cool for a singular type of server like that..

Overall I'd give the game an 80% or greater rating, and would recommend to anyone who wants something a lil different, whether its a small story with some new encounters/friends, or just running off and exploring the map.

I would love to see the game expand on everything it has, finish the dinosaur food chain, and finally come out of early access; it's got a lot of potential. As of now, 7/10 solid dinosaur game.

184587533.review:
I desperately wish I could love the isle.

I have watched all of the same youtube videos that you, the person reading this review, probably have. I have played officials; i have played unofficials. I found a community. I tried. I really, really tried. I upgraded my RAM. I downloaded the anticheat. I changed the settings.

Every server has over 100 ping. Playing it was not only miserable, but I have never been unhappier with myself then my dinosaur died to something unavoidable- a bug in the terrain, a hill obscured by copious amounts of copy-paste foliage, starvation because the poorly designed map contains no landmarks and no tutorial, and you are expected to run another tab to copy and paste your coordinates into every five minutes. Five minutes you often do not have - not between starving to death and the other players.

I, myself, due to avoiding officials have never had a particularly bad experience with other players. That was, to me at the time, the strangest thing; and now I write this review to you, whoever is reading it, after having reached my breaking point.

Don't waste your time. It's buggy, there are no good qualities, and it is not the survival game you are looking for. Play anything else- anything at all. I guarantee it, you'll find what you're looking for, and you'll be happy to have it. This might not even be the GENRE you're looking for. 

You will not love the Isle, and the Isle will not love you.

184585023.review:
The current state of the game is too hard for newcomers. Most of the people I've got to download the game just give up on it because they are tired of starving to death.

1. The game needs and in game map. The island is way to big for beginners to get started with no sense of direction. Players that have been here for a while use interactive maps online to navigate.

2. The a.i. system is bad. This should be at the top of the list for devs. If new players are lost in the jungle with no map + starving every time they play a carnivore they are going to quit. 

3. IMPORTANT.    There needs to be an immediate fix (even if the feature is not kept) to nesting. THERE HAS TO BE AN INCENTIVE for players to nest.  After nesting a certain amount of babies you should get a free mutation point or something. We would keep SOOOOOO many new players if their first experience was a parent teaching them how to play.. where to drink, find plants to eat or hunt..... right now nesting makes the game harder for no benefit, Barely anyone uses the feature
 
4. The current playable list for evirma is unbalanced. There need to be more pairs that directly compete with each other for more player interaction.

No lo recomiendo, en general la simulación del juego está bastante bien, diría que es de los mejores juegos a nivel simulación de ser un animal prehistórico, no obstante hay bastante aspectos que dejan mucho que desear:
-Los servidores se quedan cortos, 100 personas es muy poco para lo grande que es el mapa lo cual lleva al siguiente punto.
-El mapa se siente vacío salvo por 3 zonas donde se reúnen todos los jugadores a darse de palos.
-No hay curva de aprendizaje ni ningún entorno seguro en el que aprender mecánicas imprescindibles de los animales, básicamente te lanzan a la aventura siendo un bebé y sin conocer la mitad de las cosas que puede hacer tu bicho.
-Tu causa de muerte más común no serán otros jugadores, será la falta de comida ya que escasea en exceso sobretodo si juegas como carnívoro.
-No existe feedback en el combate mas allá de algún chillido así que no sabrás si vas ganando o perdiendo lo cual no te permite tomar las decisiones más acertadas.
-Jugar con amigos es un dolor porque no hay manera de spawnear conjuntamente así que apareceréis aleatoriamente rezando por estar cerca pero si no el gameplay se basará en caminar por 40 minutos o incluso 1 hora para acabar muriendo de hambre o cualquier otro motivo. y vuelta a empezar.
En resumen, un juego bastante inmersivo, se deja jugar, agradable a la vista y con mucho potencial pero que en mecánicas deja muchísimo que desear incluso sin contar bugs y errores. A día de hoy se siente como un early access que está lejos de terminarse y que lleva desde que lo compré en desarrollo, una total decepción, para mí por lo menos.
Si en algún momento van corrigiendo estos puntos los iré retirando de la reseña.

184516575.review:
This game represents the dichotomy between slow, methodical gameplay and tense, heart-racing action.

Imagine, if you will: you're a Diabloceratops, having your fill of water at the local lake. The day has been long and lonely, with no one but a tiny Beipieosaurus to keep you company. All seems to be going well until, out of the corner of your eye, you see them: a pack of Ceratosaurs. Oh. No. You race back to the cover of green, hoping your carefully crafted camouflage will save your slow, spongey body. Alas, the Ceratosaurs smelled your blood. That darn Troodon... it nipped at your ankles moments before you reached the lake. Curse you, Troodon...

Awful game. Love it. Will keep playing. Will keep raging.

184447099.review:
Produkcja ta ciągle przeżywa swoje wzloty i upadki, a decyzje podejmowane przez deweloperów budzą u mnie mieszane uczucia :p Zamiast naprawiać poważniejsze błędy, twórcy często koncentrują się na drobnych zmianach co jest po prostu frustrujące... Niektóre dinozaury, które kiedyś były ikonami gry, straciły swój blask – dobrym przykładem jest raptor, którego mechanika chwytu wciąż pozostawia wiele do życzenia. Z kolei balans rozgrywki wciąż kuleje, przez co niektóre gatunki są zdecydowanie zbyt potężne, a inne tak słabe, że granie nimi traci sens.  

Decyzja o usunięciu możliwości wyboru punktu odrodzenia to kolejny problem, który negatywnie wpływa na rozgrywkę. Grając ze znajomymi, często trzeba korzystać z map online, by odnaleźć się na po prostu strasznie dużej mapie. To wszystko często bywa strasznie czasochłonne :/

Trudno mi wydać jednoznaczną opinię o The Isle. To tytuł, który z pewnością przypadnie do gustu osobom cierpliwym, gotowym zaakceptować jego wady. Przed zakupem zdecydowanie warto obejrzeć kilka materiałów wideo, by zrozumieć, czego można się spodziewać. To po prostu dość specyficzna gra.

184438364.review:
Currently, this game is a lot of nothing. Ignoring all other discussions of bugs, AI spawning, and species pros and cons, there is nothing to this game. All you do is travel and eat until you die. You don't die? Congrats! You're reward is you walk for hours. That is the entire game.

I was super hyped about this game because from let's play's I saw online (faulty sources, I know) it seemed like a game that required a decent amount of strategy, learning, and you are constantly on a knife's edge of risk v reward. Kill or no? Wait to heal, or keep going? Run or hide? But the actual gameplay usually is either absolutely nothing happening FOR HOURS or insta death from off screen, dropping off a cliff you COULD NOT SEE, or straight up starving to death. You do not sense any other living creatures unless you are already on top of them. By then you are already lost or won. The entire sense of knife's edge risk v reward doesn't exist because YOU CANNOT PERCEIVE EITHER RISK OR REWARD! 

Most of my game play has been horrendous because it takes SO LONG to get big, so my perspective of the world is crotch shot foliage. If any plants are about 12" tall in front of/on top of me I have NO visibility. Food exists but it is so damn hard to locate. It takes a lot of walking and HOPING you will get close enough to sniff it out. Many carnivores camp at Meat Spawns to lure other prey. Cool, valid tactic, but food is so rare that you don't often have the choice to skip eating for a safer bet later, you are dying from starvation NOW. Also when you are small, you cannot even SEE the food until you are on top of it, so you aren't likely able to scope it out before swooping in.

The game has SO much potential, but there is so much of this game that feels like getting sucker punched. I am familiar with games that require you to figure it out, but when I cannot see/hear/find anything until it is too late, I am not learning. I am just getting rug pulled.

New review as of January 01, 2025:======
Okay, so I have to give a thumb down to this game after the dev's genius decision to break the whole ecosystem and game balance by making AI-controlled creatures spawns extremely plentiful (we're talking 10 animals per 100 sq. m.). This absolutely removes the survival element of the game, since now carnivores don't have to hunt players for survival.
The noobs and the people who are bad at games are extatic: at last the game became playable to them! 
Not like it wasn't: for someone who have put a few hours in and has a couple of brain cells it was still almost impossible to starve to death as a carnivore, but it seems there's a ton of people in the playarbase who are so bad that even the simple task of finding food was too hard for them.

I'll change the review when and if the devs realize how hard they screwed up.

184343578.review:
Avaliação: 6/6

O que eu mais joguei foi o Evrima. Ele é visualmente muito bonito e oferece mais opções de dinossauros.
 Porém, possui algumas desvantagens:

Jogando como herbívoro: É essencial andar em bando, o que pode ser difícil, já que o jogo não oferece ferramentas para localizar outros jogadores da mesma espécie. Você precisa se arriscar bastante para encontrar aliados, correndo o risco de ser morto por predadores no caminho.

Jogando como carnívoro ou onívoro: Você pode caçar outros jogadores ou bots. No entanto, os bots são praticamente inúteis, pois o mapa é enorme e encontrá-los é raro.

Interação limitada: O chat é apenas local, o que complica bastante a comunicação e formação de grupos, já que não há como saber onde estão outros jogadores da sua espécie no mapa. (isso é uma desvantagem, os únicos que são fáceis de formar duo é Deinos, pois nascem na água.)

Problemas técnicos:

A visão noturna do Deinosuchus (crocodilo) é péssima. Além disso, há um bug em que tudo parece claro no lago e, de repente, fica escuro como um "limbo". Não sei se é intencional, mas seria algo que a equipe deveria corrigir.

Experiência em servidores brasileiros:

O único servidor BR do Evrima que joguei foi tóxico. Muitos jogadores matavam sem motivo. Por exemplo, se você é um filhote e se aproxima de uma carcaça com muita comida disponível, a tendência seria poder comer, mas geralmente eles simplesmente te matam. Tentar socializar é quase impossível.
Por outro lado, os servidores gringos são melhores para iniciantes. Recomendo procurar um servidor com ovos disponíveis, para você nascer em uma família e aprender a jogar.

Sobre The Isle Legendary (primeira versão):

A visão noturna é ainda pior: você só vê em preto e branco, e com um alcance limitado.
É mais fácil encontrar servidores BR cheios, mas, como no Evrima, é difícil formar grupos ou bando.

Conclusão:
Não recomendo jogar The Isle Legendary no momento. Já o Evrima tem potencial, mas a experiência depende muito de encontrar o servidor certo e superar os problemas mencionados.

Minha avaliação permanece negativa até que mudanças sejam feitas.

This game is fun at first. Really cool concept. Don't play carnivore unless you have a group. Its pointless and not very much fun starving to death only to realize its pointless to solo as carnivore anyway; except the crocodile, but also pointless as croc. Actually, carnivore play is just really bad all around. Needs more AI so you don't just run around and starve as much; or be expected to take down an adult as a baby when the thing was always gonna be too big for your dino. Don't play carnivore unless you have cheats or some major advantage. Only play carnivore if you're cheating.

Its slightly less pointless to play as herbivore; unless you also have a group on discord then its kinda ok.. Play something that runs fast, everything else needs group. 

Hands down, most fun is omnivore for solo play, since you're avoiding everyone anyway. Duck is fun.

EDIT: The game stopped being fun. Mostly because it isn't fun to play any of the dinosaurs except the thing thats basically a duck, and that gets boring fast. The crocodile is fun if you manage to get to adult, kind of. But more fun to be duck and dodge crocs. 

My experience with carnivore is starving to death usually before you get past being a baby. Rename to scavenger and fix this game. LOL! Add a suicide button also. Waiting to starve is obnoxious and trying to fast swim your stamina away to drown is depressing. 

Herbivore is boring unless  you have group and carnivores to fight. They usually starve and have no hope of keeping up with your growth rate. Boring though.

Only omnivore is fun currently, and then its only the duck. Add more AI for starting carnivore or add suicide button and rename to scavenger. 

As others have said, carnivores only prey on other carnivores save maybe the croc. If some more of the other dinosaurs were viable... maybe more omnivore classes for carnivores to prey on, it might even out some.

Isn't really cohesive and has been in early access or something for 10 years. 

Could be a lot of fun.

184153252.review:
Firstly, this game is gorgeous, it is easily one of the best examples of a creature simulation game graphically. Secondly this game is great fun with friends and strangers, the community is excellent.

BUT, here is why I have to give a negative review and this will change based on updates. Currently the world mechanics are absolutely broken as a carnivore. As a herbivore you have the ability to graze, you can eat grass anywhere to keep your hunger a 25% and stave away death via starvation. As a carnivore there are SUPPOSED to be similar means of survival, small animals, fish, crustaceans etc. As of my time of writing this these small creatures are broken. 

Of my 29 hours I have had one single 2 hour run where I was able to find land animals as food playing a carnivore. The rest of my time spent playing these dinos has been a starving simulator. Pterodons are particularly broken, when skimming fish from a lake, you will be chased and hurt as well as having your fish stolen by npc bird dinos, so next option is to head to the coast. Turtles and Crabs simply do not spawn, in my 29 hours of play I have not see a SINGLE crab or turtle. I think they are a myth. 

This game is beautiful, this game is addictive, this game is unique. But like an ecosystem it means to emulate, it requires balance, currently that balance is askew and leading to a very lopsided experience unless you want to eat vegetation.

Also apparently you used to be able to pick your spawn, that would be handy considering alot of biomes are infact extra broken due to the above mentioned issue.


Update: They have fixed the ai, the game is now functioning excellently for carnivors & I have updated my review from negative to positive.

184120718.review:
I’ve been playing The Isle for years, and I have to say, it’s incredibly disappointing to see how the game has evolved—or rather, failed to evolve. Back in the day, it was a much better experience. Now, with all the recent updates, it feels like the developers have completely destroyed what made the game enjoyable. Playing The Isle just isn’t fun anymore.

The bugs are a joke. There are issues in the game now that have been around for over three years. How is that even possible? It honestly feels like the developers don’t bother testing the game before releasing updates. For a game that’s been in Early Access for so long, this lack of quality control is unacceptable.

And speaking of Early Access, how long is this game going to stay there? It’s been years, and at this point, it’s laughable. You’d expect some significant progress by now, but instead, we get updates that make the game worse. The developers really need to step up their game and put in the effort to deliver something polished.

To make matters worse, most of the dinosaurs are unplayable. In my opinion, the only ones worth playing are the Ceratosaurus and the Dilophosaurus. Everything else feels broken, unbalanced, or just not fun.

At this point, I’m losing hope. Either the developers need to start taking this project seriously and put real effort into it, or they should finally get this game out of Early Access. Right now, it feels like a wasted potential.

184051648.review:
I decided to get this game as it was on sale. I have decided that it isn't a good game at all. In fact I'd argue it's being marketed very poorly by the online community making media on it. The youtube videos show you a fun and exciting adventure everytime you boot up the game and join a server. They don't mention the fact that ever official server (legacy and Evrima) have mix-mega packs that kill everything they see, the absurdly long times it takes to grow basically anything, or the fact this game (like most other survival games) is really only fun when you've either A. Dedicated your life to learning all the little details and exploits. or B. Get a few friends together and grow as a pack to become the assholes killing everything on sight.

Lots of people in the community will then say, "Go play unofficial" truth is they have even larger problems than official does most of the time. Either have odd ass rules, super fast grow speeds meaning it's just a PvP simulator, or the fact that no one is actually playing, they're all just afk growing.

So no, I don't recommend this game. I'm just planning on logging another 4-ish hours to get my moneys worth out of it, then putting it aside until the devs decide to stop being little shitheads about the game being brutally hard for the tiny niche pvp centered survival community. Which from what I can tell, means never.

If you want a fun dino centered survival game where PvP is reserved for the hunts that make sense your best bet is probably to not buy this, or any of its competitors.

184050994.review:
This is fun if you like dinosaurs, for those of you don't, stay far far away. Even those of you who do like dinosaurs, be very vary. It takes a long time for some dinosaurs to reach full maturity, and even then you'll get one-shotted by some overpowered herbivore and lose all your progress because the game has permadeath. Game looks phenomenal as well, I think the realism is very enjoyable, especially with how damn good the game looks. Except nighttime of course. Fuvk nighttime. The Isle becomes a horror game at nighttime. Every noise is a potential bell signalling your death. And when you're finally able to lay eyes on the source of the noise, it's already too late and you've lost the last 6 hours of your eat-drink-AFK cycle progress.

Anyway, in short, its not for the faint of heart. If you decide to try, know that there is a learning curve and you will be tempted to snap your keyboard or controller in half more than once. Once that's over with, you're left a realistic, beautiful game simulating the hunt and hunted of the prehistoric era.

Prepare yourself to get frustrated with Evrima when playing a species that relies on NPC spawns.
You might start growing a croc in a small lake and it's all going well with plenty of fish coming in, but as soon as you logout it is like russian roulette, because it might be the very last time you will see any food sources with that croc. Especially if the lake is not connected to a river like East Pond you are stuck, because you can't just roam to another body of water. So you are forced to logout and hope something changes with the AI spawns again. But most likely it will be just the same when logging in again until you eventually meet the death screen after 10-20 minutes of waiting for something to show up.
Apparently they keep changing the AI systems without proper testing and therefore keep breaking it.

183893427.review:
Questo gioco sembra fantastico sulla carta ma una volta che si gioca per un po' di ore ci si rende conto che questa è solo una tech demo.
Il gioco capisco benissimo sia in beta (da 5 anni eh mica 2) ma non si può morire così spesso a causa di mancanza di cibo.
Trovare cibo da soli da piccoli è impossibile specialmente se si gioca su server con 0 ai, dove o trovi un membro della tua specie adulti che procaccia per te o sei fregato.
Sui server con L'AI di animali invece immagino ci sia un bug di gioco, è rarissimo quanto trovare oro scavando una buca in spiaggia, non ha senso che ci siano così pochi animali su una cazzo di isola sperduta con i dinosauri.
Il gioco anche una volta superati questi limiti e diventi a nostra volta adulti finisce così.
Si sopravvive e ci si mena, un peccato poichè il gameplay loop finisce così, non stimolando nessun giocatore all'esplorazione (poichè uscendo dalle area popolose si trova sicuramente 0 cibo).
La mappa è davvero DAVVERO troppo grande, ci si perde e non capisco davvero il perchè abbiano deciso di farla così grande per 110 persone attive sul server, praticamente sarà già tanto incontrarne 6 o 7 se non si gruppa con il proprio branco, il gioco purtroppo soffre anche di un problema di bilanciamento molto grave, al momento ci sono erbivori troppo forti e grossi che oneshottano praticamente tutto una volta diventati adulti, cosa facile poichè non possono morire di fame.
I carnivori si cacciano tra loro se non qualche piccolo coraggioso che decide invece di affrontare gli stegosauri e morire da guerriero nell'impresa.
Inoltre segnalo che ci sono persone che camperano fuori dai santuari (aree predilette dai cuccioli per crescere al sicuro, spoiler non avviene per nulla) oneshottando tutti i giocatori appena spawnati se non addirittura invadendo queste zone sicure facendo quello che vogliono (cosa che mi è capitato più volte).
Quindi 
- TONNELLATE DI BUG
- PESANTE DA GIRARE FLUIDAMENTE
- GAMEPLAY ROTTO COME POCHE COSE AL MONDO
- BUG 
- I CARNIVORI SI CANNIBALIZZANO PERCHE' GLI ERBIVORI SONO TROPPO FORTI

E' davvero un peccato perchè le animazioni e la grafica sono incredibile ma l'esperienza risulta troppo frustrante poichè  si muore per davvero delle cazzate e tra l'altro in maniera poco divertente.
Non ha senso attualmente dare 20 euro per questo gioco, aspettate un annetto in modo tale che sistemino ste robe e aggiungano carnivori grossi come Allosauro e Trex

183851507.review:
I have the biggest love hate relationship with this game. I have been around the game since launch and been playing since 2016. 
Surface level this game is phenomenal from a dinosaur fans perspective. You get to play as a wide variety of your favourite dinosaurs and those you may not have even heard of. Starting out as a small juvenile and having to hunt and hide to survive. The concept was amazing and was handled well for a time with updates pretty consistently.
Unfortunately that did not continue.
The game has been in "early access" for almost 10 years. The game had great ideas and layout. But terrible execution.
Was hesitant to write this review because this game does hold a special place in my heart. But reality is reality and the care isnt there. And then having 2 different versions of the game for new players to try and figure out why they arent playing the game they see online in videos is ridiculous and honestly a stupid decision. I understand there are people that play the Legacy branch still. But having it as the default for when new players join destroys any trust from them. 

With that said, it is worth the money if you like dinos. Easily get moneys worth, great with friends. Just dont expect longevity. You cant defend a game in early access for 10 years. 

But dinos are still fun.

Ill start off with I bought the game on a Christmas 2024 for 13.99 and i have to say it was a steal. The game is stunning and the dinosaur movements are actually very good. I died my first 4 characters but I maxed out a fully grown Triceratops and they are extremely tanky. The game is a semi slight grind but its not going to take you forever to hit max growth, at most depending on your dino a few hours. I've had the game for a long time. Just started playing again after watching a YouTuber play. 

Pros - 
Game is gorgeous. 
Models are amazing. 

Cons - 
Map is way too big for the population of the server.
No in-game Map makes navigating nearly impossible without a Third Party Map. 
Grow times are insane with most species. 
Herbivores are OP as hell right now. 
AI food is scarce for Carnivores.
Food/Water drain at a ridiculous rate. 
Game should be way more finished after almost ten years in development. 

Overall, if you know where the players on your server populate, it can be a great experience. Otherwise, you're oftentimes alone... wandering a map that is way too big. With no Map to show you where to go, starving because AI food doesn't really spawn that often, and the scent mechanic is misleading and nearly useless. 

The developer has been going at this for ten years. Early access is a joke. 

I've had some really good experiences. But, right now... it's just not where it should be. I don't know that it ever will be. 

That makes me sad.
